availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin governer of the state of Kentucky your petitioner would represent That he was Endited at The morgan Circuit Court for Retailing Spiritous Liquor with out Licens and that The Enditement was Through Malace and Spite he and That at The May Term 1859 They obtained a verdict against him in favour of the Commonwealth for $60, and That he is a poor man with a Large family and Scearcely any property States That if your honor will remit Said fine that the will not commit Said offence any more
Th under assigned woul Join in the abovee petition

W W Cox
H J. Roberson
Mason Gallut
Daniel Gallett
Jno Higgins
Daniel Hagins
William Patrick
Jesse Coffee

Morgan Cir Ct
$60 } Tipling
Sol. Back
Issd Mar 27. 1861

To his Exclency Beriah Magoffin
Govner of the State of Kentucky
Your petioners wood represent that the Circuit Held in M
